56-year-old.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

white female.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

saddle nose deformity.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

glottic and subglottic stenosis.context: The patient is a 56-year-old white female with a history of relapsing polychondritis, which resulted in saddle nose deformity in glottic and subglottic stenosis for which she has undergone number of procedures in the past to the upper airway.

trach dependent.context: She currently is trach dependent for her airway because of glottic and subglottic stenosis, but she is having no significant problems breathing and talking around her trach tube and came for further evaluation.

no significant problems breathing.context: She currently is trach dependent for her airway because of glottic and subglottic stenosis, but she is having no significant problems breathing and talking around her trach tube and came for further evaluation.

no significant problems talking.context: She currently is trach dependent for her airway because of glottic and subglottic stenosis, but she is having no significant problems breathing and talking around her trach tube and came for further evaluation.

Airway obstruction secondary to laryngea.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Airway obstruction secondary to laryngeal subglottic stenosis.
Postoperative Diagnosis: Airway obstruction secondary to laryngeal subglottic stenosis and tracheal stenosis.

Suspension microlaryngoscopy, rigid bron.context: Operation Performed: Suspension microlaryngoscopy, rigid bronchoscopy, dilation of tracheal stenosis.

bleeding.context: Risk and complications of bleeding, infection, alteration of with speech or swallowing, failure to improve her airway, and loss of voice.

infection.context: Risk and complications of bleeding, infection, alteration of with speech or swallowing, failure to improve her airway, and loss of voice.

alteration of with speech or swallowing.context: Risk and complications of bleeding, infection, alteration of with speech or swallowing, failure to improve her airway, and loss of voice.

failure to improve her airway.context: Risk and complications of bleeding, infection, alteration of with speech or swallowing, failure to improve her airway, and loss of voice.

loss of voice.context: Risk and complications of bleeding, infection, alteration of with speech or swallowing, failure to improve her airway, and loss of voice.

significant scarring.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

loss of laryngeal contour.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

extensive scar tissue.context: Larynx was suspended with significant scarring beginning in the supraglottic area with loss of laryngeal contour beginning in the supraglottis with extensive scar tissue at the level of the false cord obliteration of ventricles and true cords.

subglottic stenosis.context: This appeared to be stable, and airway was patent at the supraglottic and glottic level with some narrowing at the subglottic level with mild-to-moderate subglottic stenosis, otherwise this appeared to be stable.

marked narrowing.context: The patient noted to have marked narrowing with dense scarring posterolaterally on the left securing good visualization of the trach tube.

dense scarring.context: The patient noted to have marked narrowing with dense scarring posterolaterally on the left securing good visualization of the trach tube.

scar tissue.context: The patient did not appear to have any relapsing polychondritis with progressive scar tissue at the level of the trach site and the posterior trachea wall was significant.

laser.context: The LP contact tip laser was utilized to vaporize the scar tissue and release the scar banding following which the scope was passed and further dilation carried out.

dilation.context: The LP contact tip laser was utilized to vaporize the scar tissue and release the scar banding following which the scope was passed and further dilation carried out.
